com.jcraft.jsch

Interface Logger


  • public interface Logger
    Provides logging abilities to the library. An application might implement this interface to capture the logging data, or to send it to some destination.

    The library provides a default implementation which sends the output to /dev/null, i.e. does not do any logging.

    See Also:
    JSch.setLogger(com.jcraft.jsch.Logger)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEBUG
      Log level constant - the lowest level (only use for debugging).
      static int ERROR
      Log level constant: the second-highest level, something occured which should not have.
      static int FATAL
      Log level constant: the highest level: something did get so wrong that recovering is not possible.
      static int INFO
      Log level constant: The second lowest level, information.
      static int WARN
      Log level constant: the middle level, a warning.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      Checks if logging of some level is actually enabled.

      Logs some message.

    • Field Detail

      • DEBUG

        static final int DEBUG
        Log level constant - the lowest level (only use for debugging).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • INFO

        static final int INFO
        Log level constant: The second lowest level, information. Use this to get an overview what happens in the program.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • WARN

        static final int WARN
        Log level constant: the middle level, a warning.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ERROR

        static final int ERROR
        Log level constant: the second-highest level, something occured which should not have.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • FATAL

        static final int FATAL
        Log level constant: the highest level: something did get so wrong that recovering is not possible.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • isEnabled

        boolean isEnabled(int level)
        Checks if logging of some level is actually enabled. This will be called by the library before each call to log(int, java.lang.String).
        Parameters:
        level - one of the log level constants DEBUG, INFO, WARN, ERROR and FATAL.

      • log

        void log(int level,
         String message)
        Logs some message.
        Parameters:
        level - one of the log level constants DEBUG, INFO, WARN, ERROR and FATAL.
        message - the message which should be logged.
